Topic.Title: One thing is for sure, Tegra4 will be a power hog, worse than tegra3

Message.Msg: Me thinks you don't know which way is up. AMD was_NVDA_yu'd......oh. And Tegra3 (a 2 year old product) did beat_Qualcomm_yu.

Message.Title: Tablet XMAS
Message.Msg: More activations for Tablets than Smartphones on Christmas day. Nvidia benefited for sure. By the way - How big of a deal is it to replace a Tegra 3 processor with a Tegra 4 processor in an existing Tablet like Nexus 7 or Microsoft Surface RT and all the others. Not much I would think

"How big of a deal is it to replace a Tegra 3 processor with a Tegra 4 processor in an existing Tablet like Nexus 7 or Microsoft Surface RT and all the others." HUGE !!!!! "Not much I would think" you read too much whosunw...

just a clarification...I believe it's a simple swap out for Tegra 4 from Tegra 3 on the production line. Surely pin compatable. Perhaps that why the Nexus 7 16GB has been out of stock for the last two weeks with 32GB in short supply. Simple switcheroo in January with a Tegra 4 processor in January. Surely Microsoft Surface will do the same along with ASUS and Lenova. If Tegra 4 really does have 72 Kepler cores in the GPU then it will be only have a slightly slower GPU than the notebook GPU GT620M. Note: Suspect the Tegra 4 will have 96 cores like the GT620M. Another factoid......the GT640M has 384 cores and is only 118 sq. mm in die size at 28nm. See Wikipedia Nvidia GPU comparison.

Rather than just replace the non-LTE integrated tegra #3 with the non-LTE integrated tegra #4 -- which consumes even more power -- OEM's will be looking to Upgrade their mobile device systerms-on-a-chip. Yes boys, UPGRADE. That's where the Snapdragon S4 Pro Processors come in. To Upgrade from the tegra #3 or #4. Google it, boys : Snapdragon S4 Processors | Qualcomm Snapdragon Processors And be sure to play both of the really nice videos. The first one is about the totally integrated "Qualcomm City". With Everything right there -- integrated 10-times faster LTE modem, integrated graphics, integrated CPU, integrated Global Positioning Satellite radio, integrated surround sound decoding, integrated hi-def movie processing. Everything integrated. On one tiny piece of Qualcomm silicon. The second Qalcomm video is about thermal efficiency. And how to use your nvidia tegra device to melt butter. Yes, melt butter. Notice how the Qualcomm engineers are laughing at the nvidia device at the end. Yes boys, Laughing. Rather than just replace the non-LTE integrated tegra #3 with the non-LTE integrated tegra #4 -- which consumes even more power -- OEM's will be looking to UPGRADE their mobile device systems-on-a-chip. That's where the Snapdragon S4 Pro Processors come in. { CLINK ! .... Clink clink clink bink bink } There goes another tegra.

" believe it's a simple swap out for Tegra 4 from Tegra 3 on the production line." "Suspect the Tegra 4 will have 96 cores like the GT620M. " ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Your two statements suggest GT620M GPU cores with a 32-bit memory interface...

According to Wikipedia GT620M has a 128 bit memory bus. But the GT625M has a 64 bit memory bus with everything else the same as the GT20M. Of course Tegra 4 can have a dual channel 32 bit memory controller but will see Jan 6th. Anyway you cut it. tegra graphics capability is about to make an 8 year leap.

Message.Title: HTC + Qualcomm : A tablet PLUS cellphone, and a 12" tablet
Message.Msg: Here's a market-moving story from Bloomberg, boys. HTC and Qualcomm are working together on two (2) new Windows RT tablets. Yes, two (2) new tablets for 2013, boys. The first is a tablet PLUS a cellphone. You read correctly. A tablet AND a cellphone, all right there together in one slam-dunk, award-winning, highly innovative device. Will they call it a "tab-phone"? Or maybe a "phone-ablet". Either way, this highly innovative two-in-one device from HTC + Qualcomm will sell like hotcakes. Yes boys, Hotcakes. The second is an Enormous 12" tablet from HTC + Qualcomm. You read correctly. A one-footer, suitable for statuesque folks, looking for something bigger. Like maybe the Statue of Liberty. Google the market-moving news yourself, boys. Bloomberg: HTC will introduce 7-inch and 12-inch Windows RT tablets in 2013
A RMBS says what?? Every time you post, all I hear is RMBS RMBS RMBS wah wah wah!! Repeat after me...... RMBS RMBS wah wah wah...

Topic.Title: HTC + Qualcomm : A tablet PLUS cellphone, and a 12" tablet
HTC + Qualcomm : A tablet PLUS cellphone, and a 12" tablet

Message.Msg: So Best? If nvidia can't even figure out how to integrate the phone modem radio part with a basic mail-order ARM chip -- they'll be a non-starter in Qualcomm's budding new tablet + cellphone market, right? I thought so.
